org.simplity.kernel.db

Class DbDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplity.kernel.db.DbDriver

  • public class DbDriver
extends Object
    We use DbDriver as a wrapper on JDBC to restrict the features to a smaller subset that is easy to maintain.
    Author:
    simplity.org

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static char LIKE_ANY
      character used in like operator to match any characters

      • workWithDriver

        public static void workWithDriver(DbClientInterface callBackObject,
                                  DbAccessType accessType)
        only way to get an instance of RdbDriver to do rdbms operations. Necessary resources are allotted, and the passed object is called back with workWithDriver(instance)
        Parameters:
        callBackObject -
        accessType -

      • workWithDriver

        public static boolean workWithDriver(DbClientInterface callBackObject,
                                     DbAccessType accType,
                                     String schema)
        Way to get an instance of RdbDriver to do rdbms operations. Necessary resources are allotted, and the passed object is called back with workWithDriver(instance)
        Parameters:
        callBackObject -
        accType -
        schema - optional. Use Only if your application is designed to work with multiple schemas, AND this session transaction need to use a schema different from the default one
        Returns:
        true if allOK, false in case of roll-back

      • workForMultiTrans

        public static void workForMultiTrans(MultiTransClientInterface callBackObject,
                                     String schema)
        Way to get an instance of RdbDriver to do multiple transactions. SHoudl be used ONLY if the caller needs to commit() rollback() mutliple times Necessary resources are allotted, and the passed object is called back with workWithDriver(instance)
        Parameters:
        callBackObject -
        schema - optional. Use Only if your application is designed to work with multiple schemas, AND this session transaction need to use a schema different from the default one

      • getSchema

        public String getSchema()
        Returns:
        schema with which this connection is associated with

      • extractFromSql

        public int extractFromSql(String sql,
                          Value[] values,
                          DataSheet outSheet,
                          boolean oneRowOnly)
        extract output from sql into data sheet
        Parameters:
        sql - must be a single prepared sql, with no semicolon at the end.
        values - to be put into the prepared sql
        outSheet - data sheet that has the expected columns defined in it.
        oneRowOnly - true if (at most) one row is to be extracted. false to extract all rows
        Returns:
        number of rows extracted

        Parameters:

        values -
        outputNames -
        outputTypes -
        callbackObject -
        Returns:

      • hasResult

        public boolean hasResult(String sql,
                         Value[] values)
        check if this sql result sin at least one row
        Parameters:
        sql -
        values -
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one row

      • extractFromSql

        public int extractFromSql(String sql,
                          Value[][] values,
                          DataSheet outSheet)
        extract output from sql with different sets of input values into data sheet
        Parameters:
        sql - must be a single prepared sql, with no semicolon at the end.
        values - to be put into the prepared sql, one row per batch
        outSheet - data sheet that has the expected columns defined in it.
        Returns:
        number of rows extracted

      • extractFromDynamicSql

        public DataSheet extractFromDynamicSql(String sql,
                                       Value[] values,
                                       boolean oneRowOnly)
        extract output from sql that the caller has o idea about the output columns
        Parameters:
        sql - must be a single prepared sql, with no semicolon at the end.
        values - to be put into the prepared sql
        oneRowOnly - true if (at most) one row is to be extracted. false to extract all rows
        Returns:
        a data sheet with has 0 or more rows of extracted data

      • executeSql

        public int executeSql(String sql,
                      Value[] values,
                      boolean treatSqlErrorAsNoAction)
        execute a sql as a prepared statement
        Parameters:
        sql - to be executed
        values - in the right order for the prepared statement
        treatSqlErrorAsNoAction - if true, sql error is treated as if rows affected is zero. This is helpful when constraints are added in the db, and we would treat failure as validation issue.
        Returns:
        number of affected rows

      • insertAndGetKeys

        public int insertAndGetKeys(String sql,
                            Value[] values,
                            long[] generatedKeys,
                            String[] keyNames,
                            boolean treatSqlErrorAsNoAction)
        execute an insert statement as a prepared statement
        Parameters:
        sql - to be executed
        values - in the right order for the prepared statement
        generatedKeys - array in which generated keys are returned
        keyNames - array of names of columns that have generated keys. This is typically just one, primary key
        treatSqlErrorAsNoAction - if true, sql error is treated as if rows affected is zero. This is helpful when constraints are added in the db, and we would treat failure as validation issue.
        Returns:
        number of affected rows

      • workWithRows

        public int workWithRows(String sql,
                        Value[] values,
                        ValueType[] outputTypes,
                        RowIterator iterator)
        for each row in the result set of the sql, call back the iterator.
        Parameters:
        sql -
        values - for the sql
        outputTypes - value types of output parameters. null if you want us to discover it, but it will cost you a few grands :-)
        iterator - to be called back with workWithARow(row) method. iteration stops if this method returns false;
        Returns:
        number of rows iterated

      • executeBatch

        public int[] executeBatch(String sql,
                          Value[][] values,
                          boolean treatSqlErrorAsNoAction)
        execute a prepared statement, with different sets of values
        Parameters:
        sql -
        values - each row should have the same number of values, in the right order for the sql
        treatSqlErrorAsNoAction - if true, sql error is treated as if rows affected is zero. This is helpful when constraints are added in the db, and we would treat failure as validation issue.
        Returns:
        affected rows for each set of values

      • executeSp

        public int executeSp(String sql,
                     FieldsInterface inputFields,
                     FieldsInterface outputFields,
                     ProcedureParameter[] params,
                     DataSheet[] outputSheets,
                     ServiceContext ctx)
        extract output from stored procedure into data sheet
        Parameters:
        sql - must be in the standard jdbc format {call procedureName(?,?,...)}
        inputFields -
        outputFields -
        params -
        outputSheets -
        ctx -
        Returns:
        number of rows extracted

      • getTimeStamp

        public static String getTimeStamp()
        Returns:
        sql function to get time stamp

      • escapeForLike

        public static String escapeForLike(String text)
        put % and escape the text suitable for a LIKE operation as per brand of RDBMS. we have standardized on ! as escape character
        Parameters:
        text - to be escaped
        Returns:
        go ahead and send this as value of prepared statement for LIKE

      • getTables

        public static DataSheet getTables(String schemaName,
                                  String tableName)
        get tables/views defined in the database
        Parameters:
        schemaName - null, pattern or name
        tableName - null, pattern or name
        Returns:
        data sheet that has attributes for tables/views. Null if no output

      • getTableColumns

        public static DataSheet getTableColumns(String schemaName,
                                        String tableName)
        get column names of a table
        Parameters:
        schemaName - schema to which this table belongs to. leave it null to get the table from default schema
        tableName - can be null to get all tables or pattern, or actual name
        Returns:
        sheet with one row per column. Null if no columns.

      • getPrimaryKeys

        public static DataSheet getPrimaryKeys(String schemaName)
        get key columns for all tables in the schema
        Parameters:
        schemaName -
        Returns:
        sheet with one row per column. Null if this table does not exist, or something went wrong!!

                                              String tableName)
        get key columns names of a table
        Parameters:
        schemaName - possibly null
        tableName - non-null
        Returns:
        key column names

      • createArray

        public static Array createArray(Connection con,
                                Value[] values,
                                String dbArrayType)
                         throws SQLException
        delegated back to DBDriver to take care of driver related issues between Oracle and standard SQL
        Parameters:
        con -
        values -
        dbArrayType - as defined in the RDBMS
        Returns:
        object that is suitable to be assigned to an array parameter
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • createStruct

        public static Struct createStruct(Connection con,
                                  Object[] data,
                                  String dbObjectType)
                           throws SQLException
        This is delegated back to DbDriver because oracle driver does not support standard SQL way of doing this. Let DbDriver class be the repository of all Driver related issues
        Parameters:
        con -
        data -
        dbObjectType - as defined in RDBMS
        Returns:
        object that can be assigned to a struct parameter
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • createStruct

        public static Struct createStruct(Connection con,
                                  Value[] values,
                                  String dbObjectType)
                           throws SQLException
        This is delegated back to DbDriver because oracle driver does not support standard SQL way of doing this. Let DbDriver class be the repository of all Driver related issues
        Parameters:
        con -
        values -
        dbObjectType - as defined in RDBMS
        Returns:
        object that can be assigned to a struct parameter
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • createStructArray

        public static Array createStructArray(Connection con,
                                      Struct[] structs,
                                      String dbArrayType)
                               throws SQLException
        Create a struct array that can be assigned to procedure parameter. This is delegated to DBDriver because of issues with Oracle driver
        Parameters:
        con -
        structs -
        dbArrayType - as defined in the rdbms
        Returns:
        object that is suitable to be assigned to stored procedure parameter
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • getConnection

        public static Connection getConnection()
        not recommended for use. Use only under strict parental supervision. ensure that you close it properly
        Returns:
        connection object that MUST be closed by you at any cost!!

      • getAccessType

        public DbAccessType getAccessType()
        Returns:
        db access type for which this connection is geared-up for

      • sqlToJson

        public void sqlToJson(String sql,
                      Value[] values,
                      ValueType[] types,
                      String[] names,
                      ResponseWriter writer)
        extract data directly from a sql into json. Important to initialize writer and write before/after this call to ensure you have a valid json.
        Parameters:
        sql - prepared statement to be used to extract data from database
        values - to be used for the parameters in the prepared statement
        types - value types of the output row, in that order. Ensure that the result set has the out put exactly in this order
        names - names for each output column. If this is supplied, each row is written as an object with each field as key-value. If this is null, then each row is written as an array of values.
        writer - json writer. This method is going to write 0 or more arrays into this writer.

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws SQLException
        commit this transaction
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
              throws SQLException
        commit this transaction
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • extractFromSql

        public int extractFromSql(String sql,
                          Value[] values,
                          String[] names,
                          RespWriter writer,
                          boolean oneRowOnly)
        extract output from sql into data sheet
        Parameters:
        sql - must be a single prepared sql, with no semicolon at the end.
        values - to be put into the prepared sql
        names -
        writer -
        oneRowOnly - true if (at most) one row is to be extracted. false to extract all rows
        Returns:
        number of rows extracted
